hotspots.label: Water Erosion Stream
hotspots.fact: This flowing water has carved a path through the rocks and soil over time. Water is a powerful force that shapes Earth's surface by breaking down rocks and carrying them away to new places.

hotspots.label: Gravel and Stones
hotspots.fact: These light-colored rocks have been broken down from larger boulders by weathering and water movement. Over many years, big rocks become smaller stones and pebbles through natural processes.

hotspots.label: Soil and Plant Growth
hotspots.fact: The darker material contains soil mixed with decomposed plants and organic matter. Plants grow here because soil provides nutrients and water that help seeds sprout and grow into healthy plants.

hotspots.label: Sediment Layers
hotspots.fact: Different colored layers show how materials have been sorted by water movement. Heavier rocks settle faster while lighter sediment travels farther, creating visible layers in the ground.
